intro: Casearia moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan casearia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Salicaceae family, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in catkins, typical of the family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
